meanings.definition: Showing the most courage or determination
meanings.sent1: She was the deediest person in the group, always facing challenges bravely.
meanings.sent2: The knight's deediest act was when he saved the princess from the dragon.
meanings.sent3: Even the smallest dog can sometimes be the deediest when protecting its family.
meanings.sent4: Her deediest decision was to climb the mountain despite her fear of heights.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's deediest moment was running into the burning building to save the child.

meanings.definition: The act of performing a brave or noble action
meanings.sent1: His rescue of the drowning swimmer was considered the deediest of all.
meanings.sent2: In tales of old, the hero's deediest was always rescuing the kingdom from evil.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's deediest was stealing a whole bag of nuts from the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The deediest of all deeds was when she donated her entire savings to charity.
meanings.sent5: The deediest in history was when the soldier sacrificed himself to save his comrades.

meanings.definition: Characterized by bold or daring behavior
meanings.sent1: The pirate's deediest adventures were known far and wide.
meanings.sent2: Her deediest decision was to travel the world alone.
meanings.sent3: The cat's deediest move was to climb to the top of the tallest tree.
meanings.sent4: The deediest students were the ones who challenged the teacher's ideas.
meanings.sent5: The deediest explorer braved the harshest conditions to reach the summit.
